actor_awards.notes: Famous for turning down roles that became hits for Bogart (High Sierra, The Maltese Falcon, Casablanca).

filmography.title: Scarface
filmography.role_description: The coin-flipping, loyal right-hand man to Tony Camonte; the role that launched his career and established his screen persona.
filmography.plot: An ambitious and nearly insane gangster climbs the ladder of success in the mob, but his weakness is his sister.

filmography.title: Night After Night
filmography.role_description: An ex-boxer turned speakeasy owner who tries to gain class and social standing by hiring an etiquette tutor.
filmography.plot: A speakeasy owner tries to rub elbows with high society but finds his past catching up with him when his old flame arrives.

filmography.title: If I Had a Million
filmography.role_description: A forger who is given a million-dollar check but cannot cash it because he is a wanted man.
filmography.plot: A dying tycoon decides to give his money away to strangers, changing their lives in unexpected ways.

filmography.title: The Bowery
filmography.role_description: A saloon owner and bookie in 1890s New York who has a fierce rivalry with another local tough guy.
filmography.plot: Two rough-and-tumble men in the Bowery district of New York City feud over business, volunteer firefighting, and women.

filmography.title: Bolero
filmography.role_description: An ambitious dancer who rises from a coal mine to become a world-famous performer, showcasing Raft's real-life dance skills.
filmography.plot: An ambitious dancer is determined to reach the top, using a series of female partners until he finds the one he loves.

filmography.title: Limehouse Blues
filmography.role_description: A charismatic half-Chinese smuggler in London who tries to leave his criminal life for love.
filmography.plot: A smuggler in London's Limehouse district falls for a woman and tries to go straight, incurring the wrath of his jealous lover.

filmography.title: The Glass Key
filmography.role_description: A loyal political fixer who tries to clear his boss's name in a murder investigation; the first adaptation of Hammett's novel.
filmography.plot: A political boss is accused of murder, and his right-hand man tries to find the real killer amidst gang warfare.

filmography.title: Souls at Sea
filmography.role_description: A seaman involved in the slave trade who helps his friend (Gary Cooper) during a maritime disaster.
filmography.plot: A sailor is put on trial for organizing a lifeboat lottery on a sinking slave ship to determine who would survive.

filmography.title: You and Me
filmography.role_description: A former convict working at a department store who marries a fellow parolee, violating their parole conditions.
filmography.plot: Two former convicts working at a department store fall in love and marry, but secrets from their past threaten their future.

filmography.title: Spawn of the North
filmography.role_description: A fisherman in Alaska whose friendship with Henry Fonda is tested when he joins a gang of fish pirates.
filmography.plot: Two friends who run a fishing boat in Alaska find their partnership strained when one of them gets involved with Russian pirates.

filmography.title: Each Dawn I Die
filmography.role_description: A hardened gangster who befriends an innocent reporter (James Cagney) in prison and helps him expose corruption.
filmography.plot: A reporter is framed for a crime he didn't commit and sent to prison, where he slowly becomes a hardened criminal.

filmography.title: Invisible Stripes
filmography.role_description: An ex-convict trying to go straight who returns to crime to pay for his younger brother's (William Holden) future.
filmography.plot: A parolee finds it impossible to hold an honest job due to his record and is forced back into a life of crime to help his brother.

filmography.title: They Drive by Night
filmography.role_description: A tough independent truck driver fighting fatigue, crooked bosses, and a murder accusation.
filmography.plot: Two brothers struggle to make a living as truck drivers, but their lives are complicated by accidents and a murder accusation.

filmography.title: Manpower
filmography.role_description: A power line worker who gets into a dangerous love triangle with his best friend (Edward G. Robinson) and a hostess (Marlene Dietrich).
filmography.plot: Two power linesmen and best friends fall out over a woman with a troubled past.

filmography.title: Broadway
filmography.role_description: Raft plays a fictionalized version of himself, recalling his days as a hoofer in a Prohibition-era speakeasy.
filmography.plot: George Raft looks back on his early days as a dancer in a New York nightclub controlled by bootleggers.

filmography.title: Background to Danger
filmography.role_description: An American agent in Turkey who gets entangled in a Nazi plot involving forged documents.
filmography.plot: An American agent in Turkey gets involved in a plot by the Nazis to create trouble between Turkey and Russia.

filmography.title: Follow the Boys
filmography.role_description: A variety star who organizes USO shows to entertain the troops during World War II.
filmography.plot: A vaudeville hoofer tries to register for the draft but is rejected, so he organizes USO shows instead.

filmography.title: Nob Hill
filmography.role_description: A saloon owner in San Francisco who tries to rise in society to win the love of a socialite.
filmography.plot: A Barbary Coast saloon keeper falls for a Nob Hill socialite, causing friction with his current singer girlfriend.

filmography.title: Johnny Angel
filmography.role_description: A sea captain who hunts down the gold smugglers responsible for murdering his father and hijacking his ship.
filmography.plot: A sea captain investigates the theft of his father's gold shipment and the murder of the crew.

filmography.title: Whistle Stop
filmography.role_description: A slacker and small-time gambler who gets involved in a robbery plot to win back his old flame, Ava Gardner.
filmography.plot: A woman returns to her hometown and finds herself torn between a wealthy nightclub owner and her ne'er-do-well former lover.

filmography.title: Nocturne
filmography.role_description: A detective who refuses to accept that a composer's death was a suicide and risks his job to find the killer.
filmography.plot: A police detective investigates the death of a composer, convinced it was murder despite the official ruling of suicide.

filmography.title: Red Light
filmography.role_description: A man who hunts for a missing Gideon Bible that contains a clue to the identity of his brother's killer.
filmography.plot: A man searches for the Gideon Bible that contains the only clue to the identity of his brother's murderer.

filmography.title: A Bullet for Joey
filmography.role_description: An exiled American gangster hired by foreign agents to kidnap a nuclear physicist in Canada.
filmography.plot: A Canadian police inspector tries to stop a gangster who has been hired to kidnap a nuclear scientist.

filmography.title: Some Like It Hot
filmography.role_description: A mob boss whose St. Valentine's Day Massacre sets the plot in motion; a parody of his own tough-guy image.
filmography.plot: Two male musicians witness a mob hit and flee the state in an all-female band disguised as women.

filmography.title: Ocean's 11
filmography.role_description: A casino owner who unknowingly welcomes the crew planning to rob his establishment.
filmography.plot: Danny Ocean gathers a group of his World War II compatriots to pull off the ultimate Las Vegas heist.

filmography.title: Casino Royale
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance as himself, engaging in a coin-flipping gag that references his role in 'Scarface'.
filmography.plot: In an early spy spoof, aging Sir James Bond comes out of retirement to take on SMERSH.
